comments.body:
```suggestion
    # Make sure we can distinguish between an empty array and a null response
    r readraw 1
```

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +1719,1723 @@
    # Make sure we can distinguish between an empty array and a null response
    r readraw 1

    test "ZRANDMEMBER count of 0 is handled correctly - emptyarray" {

comments.body:
I amended the PR to make fetching the zmscore for an empty zset return a list of nil values.

This was done to be consistent with https://redis.io/commands/hmget and zscore, which returns a single nil value for a missing sorted set

> Because non-existing keys are treated as empty hashes, running HMGET against a non-existing key will return a list of nil values.
